intro: Mentha pulegium var. subtomentella, commonly known as lesser mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pale blue or purple, arranged in whorled clusters. The leaves and stems contain essential oils, giving the plant its characteristic minty aroma and making it useful in traditional medicine and aromatherapy.
